decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and then bring them back onto the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as hand disruption with Thoughtseize. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and disrupt their game plan while setting up powerful reanimation plays.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive creatures like Amped Raptor and Orcish Bowmasters to quickly attack and overwhelm the opponent. Supporting cards like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize help to control the opponent's board while cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional power and synergy to the deck. Additionally, Goblin Bombardment serves as a way to continually apply pressure and finish off the opponent. The mana base includes lands like Karakas and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's strategy and ensure a smooth mana curve for the aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive spells and efficient creatures to control the tempo of the game while applying constant pressure on the opponent. By combining disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will with efficient threats like Barrowgoyf and Nethergoyf, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while clocking them out with aggressive creatures. Utilizing cards like Wasteland and Daze to disrupt the opponent's mana base and spell casting, this deck aims to overpower the opponent quickly and efficiently, ending the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library quickly and win the game. The deck includes various support cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to tutor for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast provide protection against counterspells while cards like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal ramp up mana production to accelerate the combo. Overall, the deck aims to execute its combo efficiently and prevent the opponent from stopping it.

The main concept of this Legacy Aggro - Artifacts Blue deck is to utilize powerful artifact cards like Grim Monolith, Lotus Petal, and The One Ring to generate mana quickly and overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats like Glaring Fleshraker. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Kozilek's Command adds versatility and card advantage to the deck. The synergy between artifacts and key support cards creates a fast-paced and aggressive strategy to dominate the game.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly generate mana and card advantage through the use of powerful Elf creatures and spells such as Heritage Druid, Nettle Sentinel, and Glimpse of Nature. By using cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order, the deck aims to tutor for key combo pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth or Terastodon to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Allosaurus Shepherd to protect its combo and Boseiju, Who Endures to ensure important spells resolve without interference.

The deck is centered around the concept of chaining spells together in order to generate a large storm count and ultimately win the game using Tendrils of Agony. It utilizes various fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, along with rituals like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate enough mana to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The deck also has disruption elements in the form of Thoughtseize and Duress to interact with the opponent's hand. The inclusion of Gaea's Will and Ad Nauseam helps to refuel the hand and continue the storm combo.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent, then bringing them back into play using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to control the opponent's hand and tempo, allowing for the combo to be set up safely. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and selection, while Atraxa, Grand Unifier can help protect the combo pieces. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will for additional protection.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful combo cards like Reanimate, Entomb, and Animate Dead to quickly cheat out large creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier from the graveyard. It also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo pieces and control the opponent's plays. The mana base is built around color-fixing lands like Underground Sea and fetch lands like Polluted Delta to consistently cast the combo pieces. The main strategy is to efficiently bring back high-impact creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo using Mystic Forge and various artifacts like Manifold Key, Voltaic Key, and Grim Monolith to generate infinite mana or card advantage. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Glaring Fleshraker to disrupt opponent's game plan while setting up the combo pieces. The main win condition is to use The One Ring to give a creature infinite power and trample, overwhelming the opponent. The deck aims to be fast and resilient, using cards like Defense Grid to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponent's interaction.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy and protect efficient threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Murktide Regent, and True-Name Nemesis while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Force of Will, Daze, and Force of Negation. The deck aims to apply pressure early with aggressive creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, backed up by card advantage from cards like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck seeks to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck revolves around utilizing the interaction between Cephalid Illusionist, Nomads en-Kor, and Shuko to mill your library, allowing you to get powerful graveyard-based combos online. With cards like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle, you can win the game in explosive fashion once your graveyard is stocked with the right pieces. Additionally, the deck includes a suite of control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The key to success lies in efficiently assembling your combo pieces and executing your game-winning plan.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The strategy involves utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also protecting the combo pieces with Force of Will. Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty provide strong threats that can quickly close out the game once they hit the battlefield. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and filtering to help set up the combo. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through explosive reanimation plays and disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main idea of the deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and City of Traitors, and disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Moon. It aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Pyrogoyf and Broadside Bombardiers, while also utilizing powerful removal spells like Fury and Sundering Eruption. Cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere help control the opponent's plays, while Urza's Saga provides additional value in the form of artifact tutoring.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, such as Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. The deck is focused on comboing off and reanimating big threats early in the game, while also utilizing control elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect your combo pieces. The deck also includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brainstorm to help find the pieces needed for the combo. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Wasteland are included to disrupt your opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Aether Vial and various powerful creatures and disruptive spells to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. By consistently putting threats onto the battlefield and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to gain advantage and close out the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Baleful Strix and Recruiter of the Guard provide card advantage and flexibility to adapt to different situations, creating a versatile and dynamic playstyle.
